data.taskTitle: Update batch spawn to use new flow
Update batch spawn to use new flow
data.approach: Migrate /api/sessions/batch from calling am-generate-name to using IDE-based JS name generation + direct SQLite registration like /api/work/spawn does

data.taskTitle: Update batch spawn to use new flow
summary: Removed am-generate-name call that referenced non-existent tool
Added JS-based name generation using ADJECTIVES/NOUNS word lists (5184 combinations)
Added direct SQLite registration via registerAgentInDb()
Changed from jat-pending-* to jat-{AgentName} session naming
Agent name now passed to /jat:start to resume pre-registered agent

summary: Updated batch spawn process to use new IDE-based name generation flow
Removed fallback to timestamp names in session creation
Modified spawn and start command implementations to use new naming approach

suggestedTasks.title: Add Unit Tests for New Session Name Generation Flow
suggestedTasks.description: Create comprehensive unit tests for the new IDE-based session name generation process. Verify edge cases, validate naming conventions, and ensure robust behavior across different scenarios. Focus on commands/jat/spawn.md and commands/jat/start.md to fully cover the new implementation.
suggestedTasks.reason: Ensure reliability of new name generation method

suggestedTasks.title: Document Updated Session Naming Approach
suggestedTasks.description: Update developer documentation to explain the new IDE-based name generation flow for batch spawning. Include details about the removal of timestamp fallback and the new naming strategy. This should cover both developer-facing docs and any relevant API documentation.
suggestedTasks.reason: Clarify recent changes in session creation process

patterns: Prefer IDE-generated names over timestamp fallbacks

documentationNeeds: Revise developer guides for batch spawning
